TIME.comment: Given time lays at the middle of the averaging time period.

GDOP.comment: This angle is used to assess the impact of Geometric Dilution of Precision. If angle >= 150 or <= 30, then QC flag will not be lower than 4 (see abstract).

UCUR.long_name: Mean of sea water velocity U component values in 1 hour, after rejection of obvious bad data (see abstract).

VCUR.long_name: Mean of sea water velocity V component values in 1 hour, after rejection of obvious bad data (see abstract).

UCUR_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of sea water velocity U component values in 1 hour, after rejection of obvious bad data (see abstract).

VCUR_sd.long_name: Standard deviation of sea water velocity V component values in 1 hour, after rejection of obvious bad data (see abstract).

NOBS1.long_name: Number of observations of sea water velocity in 1 hour from station 1, after rejection of obvious bad data (see abstract).

NOBS2.long_name: Number of observations of sea water velocity in 1 hour from station 2, after rejection of obvious bad data (see abstract).

UCUR_quality_control.flag_meanings: no_qc_performed good_data probably_good_data bad_data_that_are_potentially_correctable bad_data value_changed not_used not_used interpolated_values missing_values
UCUR_quality_control.comment: This value is set on the basis of the offline quality controls applied in the time domain (see abstract).

VCUR_quality_control.flag_meanings: no_qc_performed good_data probably_good_data bad_data_that_are_potentially_correctable bad_data value_changed not_used not_used interpolated_values missing_values
VCUR_quality_control.comment: This value is set on the basis of the offline quality controls applied in the time domain (see abstract).

dataset_gattrs.author: Cosoli, Simone
dataset_gattrs.file_version_quality_control: Data in this file has been through the quality control procedure as described in the document: Offline QC procedures for ACORN radars.  Every data point in this file has an associated quality flag.
dataset_gattrs.citation: The citation in a list of references is: IMOS, [year-of-data-download], [Title], [data-access-URL], accessed [date-of-access]
